net.tinyos.prowler

Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.Application
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FloodRouting, SelforganizingBackbones, TestBroadcastNode.BroadcastApplication

    public abstract class Application
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents one application that sends and receives messages with a given fixed application id. You do not have to specify this application ID because the class object of your derived class is used for this purpose. The Node class demultiplexes the messages and notifies the appropriate applications. Note that the user of this framework can only have one application of each "type" running on a Node, that is what makes demultiplexing simple.
    Author:
    Gyorgy Balogh, Gabor Pap, Miklos Maroti

    • Method Detail

      • getNode

        public Node getNode()
        Returns the Node this application belongs to.

      • getSender

        public Node getSender()
        Returns the Node the last message was sent from.

      • receiveMessage

        public void receiveMessage(java.lang.Object message,
                  Node sender)
        Called when a new message is arrived for this application. The semantics is as of the ReceiveMsg.receive() event of TinyOS, except we do not manage the lifecycle of messages. It is important to note that the received message is simply a reference to the message that has been sent by the sender node, so it should not be modified.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that arrived.
        sender - The sender node of the last message.

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(java.lang.Object message)
        Sends a message via the radio to neighboring nodes where the receiveMessage(java.lang.Object, net.tinyos.prowler.Node) method will be called in the application instance of the same derived type. This method has the same semantics as SendMsg.send() in TinyOS.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the message is accepted for transmissions, in which case sendMessageDone() will be called eventually, or false if a message (maybe from another Application) is under transmission and this message is not accepted.
        See Also:
        sendMessageDone()

      • sendMessageDone

        public void sendMessageDone()
        Signaled when the message posted is sent. This method is called only if sendMessage(java.lang.Object) returned true. This has the same semantics as SendMsg.sendDone() in TinyOS.
        See Also:
        sendMessage(java.lang.Object)

      • display

        public void display(Display disp)
        Every application has the ability to display its status, though it is not constrained in any way. Using the Node.getX(), Node.getY() Display.x2ScreenX(double) and Display.y2ScreenY(double) functions might help positioning a sign.
        Parameters:
        disp -
